content: icelandic sheep headband project photos thumb is to knit a finished project approximately 2 smaller than the diameter of your head for a proper comfortable fit the finished project measures 19 5 which fits most adults adjust needle size as needed materials yarn ● approximately 30 yd of mode at rowan merino soft- color sand ● approximately 30 yd of mode at rowan merino soft- color denim needles ● us 9 5 5mm 24 in circular needle ● us 10 6mm 24 in circular needle miscellaneous ● 3 stitch markers ● tapestry needle to weave in ends gauge ● 4 inch row= 20 stitches ● 4 inch columns= 22 stitches project notes pattern this pattern includes an alternating motif of an icelandic sheep and a traditional fair isle cast on 96 stitches snowflake the pattern repeats three times to create the headband this pattern has row 1 * k1 p1 repeat from * to end of row long floats that require catching making this row 2-3 repeat row 1 an intermediate difficulty project row 4-19 knit the chart as shown add a stitch marker each time the to determine sizing measure the pattern repeats circumference of your head along the path row 19-22 repeat ribbing as described in that you would like the headband to fit i row 1 wanted it to fit at an angle as shown in the photo so i measured from the top of my bind off and style forehead and over my ears a good rule of ravelry- alyssakaat 2025 pg 1 ravelry- alyssakaat 2025 pg 2
